titleproper.value:
Guide to the Arthur Gordon Papers
                    <num>MC 160</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Celeste Brewer.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2016-06-08T11:08-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The collection contains manuscripts by the short story and nonfiction article writer Arthur Gordon. Gordon took the pen name Gordon Ramsey to distinguish himself from the editor Arthur Gordon (of 
                <emph render="italic">Good Housekeeping</emph>, 
                <emph render="italic">Cosmopolitan</emph> and 
                <emph render="italic">Guidepost</emph> magazines). Gordon served in the U.S. Naval Reserve as a lieutenant commander, including as a navigating officer during World War II, and most of his work dealt with life aboard ship. He was published in 
                <emph render="italic">Country Gentleman</emph>, 
                <emph render="italic">Liberty</emph>, 
                <emph render="italic">Colliers</emph>, and 
                <emph render="italic">Argosy</emph> magazines, among others. He attended a professional clinic for writers at NYU on the GI Bill, and later taught writing skills at NYU (1950).

p.value: Open to the public. Some original papers in Volume I are brittle and have been replaced with access copies within the original order of the collection. The originals are stored separately and should not be used due to their fragility.

Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Arthur Gordon Papers; MC 160; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

Sources: 1. Biographical sketch for The Week magazine, 1940; Arthur Gordon Papers; MC 160; box 1; folder 9; New York University Archives, Elmer Holmes Bobst Library, 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries. 2. "Troop Ships are Never Dull" magazine article; 1949; Arthur Gordon Papers; MC 160; box 1; folder 9; New York University Archives, Elmer Holmes Bobst Library, 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries. 3. Journal entry: resuming writing after World War II; January 1, 1946; Arthur Gordon Papers; MC 160; box 1; folder 9; New York University Archives, Elmer Holmes Bobst Library, 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Though Gordon lived until 1975, the last manuscripts in the collection date from 1957.

subject.value: World War, 1939-1945 |x Campaigns |z Pacific Ocean |v Fiction

The materials in this folder are related to the provenance of the collection, and were never included in the three bound volumes created by Gordon.
